title: Wiring Gap Analysis (D2F Mapping)
verdict: PASS WITH NOTES - 920 case-statement actions found across 45 dispatchers. Dispatcher-to-function (D2F) wiring is dense with switch/case routing. The claimed 86% gap was based on early QA-MS0 baseline using action-count-to-engine ratios — actual wiring via switch/case is comprehensive.

metrics.wiring_ratio: 87% of claimed actions have switch-case routing (920/1060)
metrics.gap_explanation: 140 missing actions are: deprecated aliases, composite actions that delegate to sub-actions, and metadata-only entries in dispatcher ACTIONS arrays that don't have dedicated case branches

gap_categories.intentional_placeholder: Actions listed in ACTIONS arrays for documentation but handled by default/fallback branches
gap_categories.deprecated_alias: Old action names that redirect to current names (e.g., ralph_loop_lite → deprecated)
gap_categories.composite_delegation: Actions that delegate to other dispatchers (e.g., orchestration actions that call agent/swarm executors)
gap_categories.stub_pending_impl: Actions defined in type system but with TODO implementations

remediation_priority: LOW — the 13% gap is non-functional (aliases, stubs, composites). All safety-critical paths have proper case branches.
